roleset.name: surprise, shock, be jostled physically or mentally

example.name: just transitive
example.text: The decline surprised analysts and jolted HomeFed's stock, which lost 8.6% of its value, closing at $38.50 on the New York Stock Exchange, down $3.625.
example.arg: HomeFed's stock, which lost 8.6% of its value, closing at $38.50 on the New York Stock Exchange, down $3.625.

example.name: ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Between flashes , certain areas in subjects ' brains are jolted with a magnetic stimulator .

example.name: arg 1
example.text: Lucille Gorman has become amazingly immune to stock-market jolts.

example.name: shocked
example.text: after the nasty jolt of the 190.58 point plunge in the Dow Jones
example.arg: of the 190.58 point plunge in the Dow Jones

roleset.note: JOLT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'jolt' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from jolt.01-v predicate notes)
JOLT-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes. Comparison to jerk.01-v and jolt.01-v. Jerk.01 is a member of VN class push-12-1. Framed by Katie. (from jolt.01-n)

roleset.name: impelled action

example.name: action as PP
example.text: The stock has fallen $87.25, or 31%, in the three trading days since announcement of the collapse of the $300-a-share takeover jolted the entire stock market into its second-worst plunge ever.
example.arg: announcement of the collapse of the $300-a-share takeover

roleset.note: JOLT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'jolt' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from jolt.02-v predicate notes)
